wikipedia_page.main: Donal Raymond Lamont, MA, STL, OCarm (27 July 1911 – 14 August 2003), was an Irish-Rhodesian Catholic bishop and a Roman Catholic missionary to Africa who was best known for his fight against white minority rule in Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe).

response: * Donal Lamont (1911 - 2003) - Bishop of Mutare, Zimbabwe, nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize in 1978
* Donal Lamont - Catholic bishop of Umtali/Mutare 1957–82, an outspoken opponent of the Ian Smith government; expelled from Rhodesia in 1977 after a high-profile trial
:14 August – Donal Lamont, former Catholic Bishop in Rhodesia (born 1911).

* September – The Prime Minister of Zimbabwe, Robert Mugabe, paid a three-day state visit to Ireland with his wife, Sally. A guard of honour from the 5th Infantry Battalion greeted him at Dublin Airport, and the Army No. 1 Band played. The Taoiseach, Garret Fitzgerald, hosted a lunch in his honour at Iveagh House, and a banquet was held in Dublin Castle. Mugabe met Bishop Donal Lamont at Maynooth College on 9 September.Blunders and mix-ups at Mugabe visit Irish Independent, 27 December 2013.Confusion over 1983 Mugabe banquet Irish Independent, 27 December 2013.Mugabe's visit to Maynooth – 9 September 1983   Saint Patrick's College, Maynooth. Retrieved: 28 December 2013.
* 27 July – Donal Lamont, Catholic Bishop in Rhodesia (died 2003).

link_mentions.page: List of people on the postage stamps of Kenya

response: * Donal Lamont – Rhodesian bishop, leading anti-apartheid campaigner

* 24 February – Catholic Bishop of Umtali Donal Lamont had a 10-year prison sentence reduced to 4 by the Appeal Court in Salisbury. 3 of the 4 years were suspended. He was convicted in 1976 of failing to report the presence of terrorists
*14 August - Donal Lamont, former Catholic Bishop in Rhodesia (born 1911).
